com.example.ARmirrorS.Client.ARProc.Utils

Class AugmentedImageFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.google.ar.sceneform.ux.BaseArFragment
        • com.google.ar.sceneform.ux.ArFragment
          • com.example.ARmirrorS.Client.ARProc.Utils.AugmentedImageFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.ar.sceneform.Scene.OnPeekTouchListener, com.google.ar.sceneform.Scene.OnUpdateListener

    public class AugmentedImageFragment
extends com.google.ar.sceneform.ux.ArFragment

    Class AugmentedImageFragment

    Class AugmentedImageFragment handles Setting up the augmented image fragment view and ties it to the AR core session. Class extend the ArFragment to customize the ARCore session configuration to include Augmented Images, and not just ttrack horizontal and vertical planes. the role of SLAVE.

    Since:
    2019-12-05
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Yussuf Khalil, Daniel King, ykhalil2@illinois.edu, dking32@illinois.edu
    See Also:
    AugmentedImageDatabase, Config, Session, ArFragment

    • Method Detail

      • getSessionConfiguration

        protected com.google.ar.core.Config getSessionConfiguration(com.google.ar.core.Session session)
        Configure the AR session and AugmentedImageFragment view which holds our camera interactions. First we set our configuration parameters to use Auto Focus and Latest updated image as well as use HDR lighting for rendering purposes. Secondly, we set the plane detection method based on user input. And finally configure the session and tie the session to our ARSceneView. In case augmented image tracking is required we also setup augmented image database.
        Overrides:
        getSessionConfiguration in class com.google.ar.sceneform.ux.ArFragment
        Parameters:
        session - AR session to configure.
        Returns:
        AR session configuration object.

      • setupAugmentedImageDatabase

        private boolean setupAugmentedImageDatabase(com.google.ar.core.Config config,
                                            com.google.ar.core.Session session)
        configure an AugmentedImageDatabase, by adding Bitmap to DB directly. After reading the bitmap image, Create the augmented image database object and add the bitmap image to it. Finally update our configuration with the database and image and return.
        Parameters:
        config - Configuration object for the current AR session of the Augmented Image Fragment.
        session - AR session to configure.
        Returns:
        true if augmented image to track has been read successfully and added to database.
